description: Unrecorded deed versus subsequent purchaser with notice
facts: David sold his house to Emily with a valid deed on January 1
David then sold the same house to Frank on February 1
Frank had actual knowledge of the earlier sale to Emily before purchasing
Frank recorded his deed immediately after purchase
asp_facts: property_claim(claim3). claimant(claim3, emily). respondent(claim3, frank). claim_type(claim3, title_priority). property_type(claim3, house). first_sale_valid(claim3, yes). first_deed_recorded(claim3, no). second_sale_occurred(claim3, yes). second_deed_recorded(claim3, yes). second_buyer_had_notice(claim3, yes). second_buyer_good_faith(claim3, no).
question: Does Emily have superior title to the property over Frank?
rationale: Under recording statutes, a subsequent purchaser must be a bona fide purchaser without notice to prevail. Frank had actual knowledge of Emily's prior purchase, so he is not a bona fide purchaser and Emily retains superior title.
